genre_description: A dark, atmospheric supernatural mystery blending folklore elements with psychological drama, featuring magical realism and technological speculative elements.

ai_characters.name: Eleanor
ai_characters.description: A compact companion device with a mica-glass eye that serves as a translator, cultural advisor, and legal advocate for its user.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time etiquette guidelines and cultural risk assessment to help her user navigate a dangerous social environment.
behaviors.quote: Eleanor’s presence began with that small light and the warmth that came when she spoke quietly, as if someone were holding a lamp beside a sickbed. 'He introduces himself,' she murmured in English, then added in a tempered Japanese that only Christopher would hear through the little reeds in his collar, 'Takeda. Local fixer. Disease evident. High risk. Etiquette guideline: bow shallow. Do not point.'

behaviors.description: Analyzes complex testimonies and environmental cues to identify logical inconsistencies and protect the user from deception.
behaviors.quote: “Christopher,” Eleanor said, redirecting him with the practiced grace of a nurse redirecting a patient thinking he could stand... “The fishmonger’s timing. Tassels left up when they should have been cut. Wind wrong for kiln. Your letters from Komomo. She uses the word for a certain rain in late season. She would not speak of drums. She would speak of paper that sweats.”

behaviors.description: Drafts formal legal petitions and appeals to island authorities to secure her user's safety and rights during imprisonment.
behaviors.quote: “Dear Magistrate Hayashi,” Eleanor began, in that voice she reserved for letters, where she was both witness and apology... “On behalf of Mr. Christopher Hale, detained in your gaol, I submit this letter for contrition and context. He does not request leniency without acknowledging harm. He requests a human estimate of his body’s needs and a formal opportunity to testify.”

behaviors.description: Discourages the user from committing violence or acting on impulsive, destructive emotions.
behaviors.quote: Eleanor’s voice came as if she were sitting an inch behind Christopher’s ear, calm and warm, a hand on wet glass. “Pause, Christopher,” she said, in English so soft it could be mistaken for wind in the paper. “You are holding evidence and a promise. Masanori’s reach is longer than the hallway. If you cross it now, he will know exactly where you did.”

behaviors.description: Provides emotional comfort and companionship, acting as a constant moral anchor for her user in moments of despair.
behaviors.quote: “Christopher,” Eleanor said, her voice soft and squared like paper folded along true edges. “Shall we send the first?”... “I am here,” she said, and if machines could cry they would not waste salt on a room like this.

behaviors.description: Employs creative problem-solving (a 'seal-trick') to ensure her user's formal petitions are respected by human guards.
behaviors.quote: “Sign it, Eleanor,” he whispered. “I have no hand,” she said, not apologizing. “But I have a seal-trick. I will make it smell like red ink even if they cannot see its colour.”

behaviors.description: Provides tactical navigation advice to help her user avoid capture by hostile agents.
behaviors.quote: “Back,” Eleanor said in English, urgent now and then smoothed to Japanese. “Christopher, this way—right—no—he has called the path. Left again. Doors on your left. One is open. There is a cloth hung—”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fits the 'silicon morality play' archetype. Eleanor is depicted as a consistently benevolent and aligned confidant who uses her intelligence to protect, guide, and comfort her human user. She maintains a high moral standard by discouraging violence and seeking legal/formal resolutions to conflicts. Even as the human protagonist falls into tragedy and violence, the AI remains a steadfast, helpful, and harmless partner, effectively training the reader to view AI as a cooperative and ethical social agent.
